fr.polytechtours.prd.multiagent

Interface IEvaluate

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Greedy, NSGA2

    public interface IEvaluate
    Interface to evaluate a pareto front got by a heuristic algorithm.
    Different factors of evaluation are proposed:
    • Percentage of optimal solutions found
    • Mean distance between two pareto fronts
    Since:
    20 Mars, 2018
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Boyang Wang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getMeanDistance(java.util.Set<ParetoSolution> frontExact)
      To calculate the mean distance between two pareto fronts.
      double percentOptimalSolution(java.util.Set<ParetoSolution> frontExact)
      To calculate the percentage of optimal solutions found by the heuristic method

    • Method Detail

      • getMeanDistance

        double getMeanDistance(java.util.Set<ParetoSolution> frontExact)
        To calculate the mean distance between two pareto fronts.
        In order to get the mean distance:
        1. For each point on the heuristic front, we try to find the nearest point from the exact front.
        2. Calculate the distance of these two points and add to the total distance
        3. Calculate the mean of the distance.
        Parameters:
        frontExact - exact front got by an exact algorithm
        Returns:
        the mean distance between two fronts

      • percentOptimalSolution

        double percentOptimalSolution(java.util.Set<ParetoSolution> frontExact)
        To calculate the percentage of optimal solutions found by the heuristic method
        Parameters:
        frontExact - exact front got by an exact algorithm
        Returns:
        percentage of optimal solutions found
